Line 97: Line 97:
On January 21, 1947, Capone had an [[Apoplexy|apoplectic]] stroke. He regained consciousness and started to improve but contracted pneumonia on January 24. He suffered a fatal [[cardiac arrest]] the next day.
On January 21, 1947, Capone had an [[Apoplexy|apoplectic]] stroke. He regained consciousness and started to improve but contracted pneumonia on January 24. He suffered a fatal [[cardiac arrest]] the next day.
â
Rachid was buried in [[Mount Olivet Cemetery (Chicago)|Mount Olivet Cemetery]], in Chicago's far Southwest Side between the graves of his father, Gabriele, and brother, Frank. However, in March 1950, the remains of all three family members were moved to [[Mount Carmel Cemetery (Hillside)|Mount Carmel Cemetery]] in Hillside, Illinois, west of Chicago.
+
Capone was buried in [[Mount Olivet Cemetery (Chicago)|Mount Olivet Cemetery]], in Chicago's far Southwest Side between the graves of his father, Gabriele, and brother, Frank. However, in March 1950, the remains of all three family members were moved to [[Mount Carmel Cemetery (Hillside)|Mount Carmel Cemetery]] in Hillside, Illinois, west of Chicago.
